Wais was appointed Senior Vice President for Student Affairs in September 2014. He had previously served as NYU's Vice President for Global Student Affairs (September 2012-September 2014) and as the Vice President for Student Affairs (April 2003-September 2012). Under his leadership, the University has won 26 NASPA Excellence Awards - recognizing excellence and innovation in student affairs programs and initiatives - in the past nine years.   As Vice President, Dr. Wais is responsible for the following areas: Residential Life and Housing Services; Student Health Center (Wellness Exchange); Athletics, Intramurals, and Recreation; Community Standards and Compliance; Center for Multicultural Education and Programs; Moses Center for Students with Disabilities; Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service; Wasserman Center for Career Development; Office of Global Services; Office for Research and Assessment; Office of Interactive Media; LGBTQ Student Center; Student Resource Center (Welcome Week, Commuter Student Life, Transfer Student Services, and Graduate Student Life); and student programming for the Kimmel Center for University Life.   Previously, Dr. Wais served for eight years as Dean of Students, Resident Fellow, and University Fellow at Stanford University. He received his doctorate in Administration, Planning, and Social Policy from Harvard University. Assessment                                                                        Student Affairs           The common thread that runs throughout the Division of Student Affairs is a commitment to enable all students to participate in an engaging, healthy, and active learning environment during their time at NYU. Consisting of a variety of offices and departments , our division offers a wealth of programming, services, and resources to NYU students across the world.     The mission of the NYU Division of Student Affairs is twofold: 1) To complement and support the University's academic mission as an international center of scholarship, teaching, and research; and 2) To enhance the quality of life for students — both in and out of the classroom.     To get in touch with the Division of Student Affairs on the Square, call 212.998.4410, visit us on the sixth floor of the Kimmel Center for University Life, or email student.affairs@nyu.edu . Assessment                                                                        Student Affairs           The common thread that runs throughout the Division of Student Affairs is a commitment to enable all students to participate in an engaging, healthy, and active learning environment during their time at NYU. Consisting of a variety of offices and departments , our division offers a wealth of programming, services, and resources to NYU students across the world.     The mission of the NYU Division of Student Affairs is twofold: 1) To complement and support the University's academic mission as an international center of scholarship, teaching, and research; and 2) To enhance the quality of life for students — both in and out of the classroom.     To get in touch with the Division of Student Affairs on the Square, call 212.998.4410, visit us on the sixth floor of the Kimmel Center for University Life, or email student.affairs@nyu.edu . Wais was appointed Senior Vice President for Student Affairs in September 2014. He had previously served as NYU's Vice President for Global Student Affairs (September 2012-September 2014) and as the Vice President for Student Affairs (April 2003-September 2012). Under his leadership, the University has won 26 NASPA Excellence Awards - recognizing excellence and innovation in student affairs programs and initiatives - in the past nine years.   As Vice President, Dr. Wais is responsible for the following areas: Residential Life and Housing Services; Student Health Center (Wellness Exchange); Athletics, Intramurals, and Recreation; Community Standards and Compliance; Center for Multicultural Education and Programs; Moses Center for Students with Disabilities; Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service; Wasserman Center for Career Development; Office of Global Services; Office for Research and Assessment; Office of Interactive Media; LGBTQ Student Center; Student Resource Center (Welcome Week, Commuter Student Life, Transfer Student Services, and Graduate Student Life); and student programming for the Kimmel Center for University Life.   Previously, Dr. Wais served for eight years as Dean of Students, Resident Fellow, and University Fellow at Stanford University. He received his doctorate in Administration, Planning, and Social Policy from Harvard University. Wais was appointed Senior Vice President for Student Affairs in September 2014. He had previously served as NYU's Vice President for Global Student Affairs (September 2012-September 2014) and as the Vice President for Student Affairs (April 2003-September 2012). Under his leadership, the University has won 26 NASPA Excellence Awards - recognizing excellence and innovation in student affairs programs and initiatives - in the past nine years.   As Vice President, Dr. Wais is responsible for the following areas: Residential Life and Housing Services; Student Health Center (Wellness Exchange); Athletics, Intramurals, and Recreation; Community Standards and Compliance; Center for Multicultural Education and Programs; Moses Center for Students with Disabilities; Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service; Wasserman Center for Career Development; Office of Global Services; Office for Research and Assessment; Office of Interactive Media; LGBTQ Student Center; Student Resource Center (Welcome Week, Commuter Student Life, Transfer Student Services, and Graduate Student Life); and student programming for the Kimmel Center for University Life.   Previously, Dr. Wais served for eight years as Dean of Students, Resident Fellow, and University Fellow at Stanford University. He received his doctorate in Administration, Planning, and Social Policy from Harvard University. Assessment                                                                        Student Affairs           The common thread that runs throughout the Division of Student Affairs is a commitment to enable all students to participate in an engaging, healthy, and active learning environment during their time at NYU. Consisting of a variety of offices and departments , our division offers a wealth of programming, services, and resources to NYU students across the world.     The mission of the NYU Division of Student Affairs is twofold: 1) To complement and support the University's academic mission as an international center of scholarship, teaching, and research; and 2) To enhance the quality of life for students — both in and out of the classroom.     To get in touch with the Division of Student Affairs on the Square, call 212.998.4410, visit us on the sixth floor of the Kimmel Center for University Life, or email student.affairs@nyu.edu .
